page.title: 20WEATHER IN LITTONDALE
page.content:
Littondale is situated in the upland areas of the Pennines, and, therefore, attracts quite a lot of wet weather. The winters tend to be long, more often then not very cold, with quite a lot of snow, and or rain. The prevailing wind is west/south west, which means in tends to blow from the top end of the Dale. Our late spring and summer tend to merge, and frequently autumn is over quickly. In good summers, temperatures in the Dale bottom can be surprisingly high.
AUTHORS OF THIS SECTION This section is the combined work of the 17 children of Arncliffe Primary School on roll in the Summer Term, 1985, together with their teachers, the other staff of the school, and members of the village of Arncliffe.
